{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with pain during sexual intercourse and crampy pelvic pain that starts one day before menses and lasts for 7 days. These symptoms, along with rectovaginal tenderness on physical examination, suggest the possibility of endometriosis. The next step in management would be to perform laparoscopy, which is the gold standard for diagnosing endometriosis. CA-125 levels are not specific for endometriosis and are not recommended as a first-line diagnostic test. Hysterectomy and hysteroscopy are not indicated in the management of endometriosis.", "answer_choice": "C"}
